content: What do we live for, if it is not to make life less difficult for each other? — George Eliot
author: Zen Quotes

content: A Hero is an ordinary individual who finds the strength to persevere and endure in spite of overwhelming obstacles. — Christopher Reeve
author: Zen Quotes

content: As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't. — Laurence J. Peter
author: Zen Quotes

content: Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now. — Ralph Marston
author: Zen Quotes

content: Anything you may hold firmly in your imagination can be yours. — William James
author: Zen Quotes

content: Remember that the best relationship is one in which your love for each other exceeds your need for each other. — Dalai Lama
author: Zen Quotes

content: Each day your life grows a day shorter. Make every move count. — Ming-Dao Deng
author: Zen Quotes

content: Life is ours to be spent, not to be saved.  — D. H. Lawrence
author: Zen Quotes

content: Faith means believing the unbelievable. — Gilbert Chesterton
author: Zen Quotes

content: Discipline is the mark of intelligent living. — Sathya Sai Baba
author: Zen Quotes

content: A day without laughter is a day wasted. — Charlie Chaplin
author: Zen Quotes

content: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal. — Henry Ford
author: Zen Quotes

content: Even if our home burns down we can rebuild it. But the things that we got for nothing, we can never replace. — Earl Nightingale
author: Zen Quotes

content: Be gentle with yourself. Think less and feel more. Be as happy as you can. You only have this moment. — Dan Millman
author: Zen Quotes

content: Instead of thinking outside the box, get rid of the box. — Deepak Chopra
author: Zen Quotes

content: You must conceive it in your heart and mind before you can receive it. If you believe then all things are possible. — Norman Vincent Peale
author: Zen Quotes

content: Do not ignore your gift. Your gift is the thing you do the absolute best with the least amount of effort. — Steve Harvey
author: Zen Quotes

content: Great loves too must be endured. — Coco Chanel
author: Zen Quotes

content: Be confident, not certain. — Eleanor Roosevelt
author: Zen Quotes

content: Victims recite problems, leaders provide solutions. — Robin Sharma
author: Zen Quotes

content: I put my heart and soul into my work, and I have lost my mind in the process. — Vincent van Gogh
author: Zen Quotes

content: Information changes your mind. Action changes your circumstances. — Jack Butcher
author: Zen Quotes

content: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young.  — Henry Ford
author: Zen Quotes

content: It takes a minute to have a crush on someone, an hour to like someone, and a day to love someone... but it takes a lifetime to forget someone. — Kahlil Gibran
author: Zen Quotes

content: Facts are the enemy of truth.  — Miguel de Cervantes
author: Zen Quotes

content: Confidence comes not from always being right but not fearing to be wrong. — Unknown
author: Zen Quotes

content: The most important battle is one to conquer yourself. — Yanni
author: Zen Quotes

content: Invisible things are the only realities. — Edgar Allan Poe
author: Zen Quotes

content: Raise your words, not voice. It is rain that grows flowers, not thunder. — Rumi
author: Zen Quotes

content: A change is brought about because ordinary people do extraordinary things. — Barack Obama
author: Zen Quotes
